Fields.DialogueText: Is there anything wrong with the ship?
What in blazes did you wake me for?
Be a sport; no one likes a whiner.
Uzi, my dear friend, whatever is on your mind?
Ugh. That's an unkind reminder, Kappi.
"My dear friend?" What a way to remind a girl she's been rejected.
After I bore myself open to you... Tsk tsk.

Fields.MenuText: I wanted to see what would happen.
Not interested.
What the hell are you talking about?

Fields.DialogueText: What is it that you're looking forward to?
Boo, you're no fun. You don't pay enough attention, Cap.
My bitterness burns! I spy a black-hearted filly to take it out on!
It's easy to tell you're just trying to provoke me.
Kapitän! We're coming up on a small group of combatants.
I assume they must have strayed from the main unit; I can't find any land mass or main force for them to regroup to.
What's wrong with you, man? Your speech is... unnatural.
Whatever. We're going after it. Just notify the crew.

Fields.MenuText: You think it's just a straggler?
You think this could be a trap?

Fields.DialogueText: I think it's bait. But bait I want to take.
I think I get to take Nixen down either way.
More stragglers on the horizon, Cap.
Uzi, what are you doing here?
Something's off. Something I really don't understand.
Nein, that's something I understand fairly well.
Maybe this would be easier if you told me what's wrong. Did you see something?
That's the thing, I don't see anything.
Nein, when I say I don't see anything, I mean literally. I have... more blind spots than I had before.
I can usually snipe anything down and see it all from down here.
But I feel a blankness. There's not even water there, only empty blackness.
... I need to speak with Admiral Cutter.

Fields.MenuText: I... I understand. I'll get you to him.
Can I go with you?
What if I don't like that idea?

Fields.DialogueText: I have other orders to think about, Kapitän!
I'm sorry, I don't feel myself today. I'll be in my room.
Uzi, a few threats are approaching.
Out with it, man. What's got your tongue?
I know. In a way, I'm grateful she's finally getting some rest, but--
But she normally has to be torn away from her post, or ordered away.

Fields.MenuText: She is. I agree.
She's working through it. And she knows where to find us if she wants our help.

Fields.DialogueText: You should be doing something about it.
That's quite a bit of resentment I spy in your eyes, Bethke.
You're not about to strike your commanding officer, are you?
He was going to be mad either way...
Is that because you're going to fail to do anything about it?
I'm going to do you the favor of forgetting you just shouted in my face, Lieutenant. But I think you should take a walk.

Fields.MenuText: I think she's afraid that the Morganas have found a way to block her perceptions.

Fields.DialogueText: Uzi, what's wrong? You've been lifeless for days.
Na und? What's it to you? I'm still doing my job, aren't I?

Fields.MenuText: No, you aren't. One of your jobs is to be my comrade.
Fair enough, I shouldn't meddle.
True, but I care about you. I'm your friend.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't you run away from me!
I... I'm not allowed to say.
In that case, I'll just have to ask him.
Kapitän, what's going on with your face?
Multiple U-boat losses in the last week. It's unclear if the Morganas have new technology in play or if we've just been unlucky.
So sudden...! What does that mean for us?
There will always be casualties in war.
U-boats get into hard fights. I'm not surprised, but...

Fields.MenuText: What if we're going to be targeted?
What if this wasn't just the Morganas?
Is this why our Belle has been so down lately?

Fields.DialogueText: Kapitän! There's a Nixe out there.
I have my post to attend to.
So, who are you in contact with?
Admiral Cutter. Or at least his office.
And? What does our Belle know about this?
I haven't been able to ask her what she knows.
But she's not completely in the dark.
If you're talking about me, I am fairly in the dark.
Is something wrong with your sensors? With your eyes?
No riddles, Uzi. Tell me what's wrong.
I think that... I was able to see faraway waters through my sisters' eyes.
I had a small connection to them...
I could tell when some of them were gone.
I just feel like I've lost a part of myself.
And I just... want to fill that void with the tears of my enemies.
Get it? Verstehen sie? Let's find someone to beat up.
Technically, it may be more "still" than "again."
Kappi, don't you think you're being a little clingy lately?

Fields.MenuText: Not at all.
I beg your pardon?
Yes.

Fields.DialogueText: You heard me. You're sticking to me like glue.
Then what have you got to say about it!?
Friends take care of each other.
I... I'm having an emotional overload. I'd rather not deal with it right now.
Bloodlust masks the pain. Let's find another Nixe.
You're... the only one I can count on.
Is this getting out of control...?
Get ready! Those Morganas will not get away this time!
Well, I'm still a little morose, but...
I'm going to try not to let anything bring me down.
I can't dwell for this long.
I'll simply fight that much harder... for the fallen.
Kapitän, I have something... personal that I want to ask you.
I didn't think we were that friendly. Are you sure I'm the one you want to ask about this?
U-37? Are you really certain you should be asking me?
Kapitän, she and I were... closer before. But that ended.
And while she's feeling alone like this, I think I should really try to be there for her.
Because she needs someone to lend an ear, a helping hand, and a shoulder to cry on.
I want to show restraint but... what do you think? Should I try to get close to her again?

Fields.MenuText: This is none of my business at all.
I don't think there's any harm in reaching out, as long as you're clear that it isn't about you.
No, your unrequited feelings will add more stress.

Fields.DialogueText: Fair enough... I just wanted your... wisdom on this, Kapitän.
Really? I'm worried that she'd rather be alone right now.
That's all I want to say about that. You're dismissed, Lieutenant.
Lay low! We have a chance to strike them off guard! Prepare for combat!
Good work; you really outdid yourself.
Don't treat me to lip-service; I don't need glory.
Uzi, it's good to be humble but... you're allowed to acknowledge your own accomplishments.
Maybe... you would love yourself a little more.
Why would you say something like that?

Fields.MenuText: You never give yourself enough credit.
You don't pamper or cherish yourself.
You're trying to kill yourself on the battlefield.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm humble. Is that so wrong?
I don't need fancy things. Is that so wrong?
When did you become my shrink?
Look, Kapitän, I can make decisions for myself.
... Want to play some cards? Like we used to?

Fields.MenuText: Not this time.
All right.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine. Fine. Just try to spread the love, and give some credit to the crew, all right?
I think you don't believe you deserve any credit. And that's a bad sign.
I think how little you take care of yourself shows how little you value yourself.

Fields.MenuText: Sure. I might even let you win.

Fields.DialogueText: Were you talking to someone just now?
Another member of my family has... gone silent.
I could feel it, before I was told.
Just... an emptiness where before there was... substance.
It was like losing family but also losing my eyes.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry for your loss.
Damn. Are we going to be next?
That's fine.

Fields.DialogueText: Will you sit with me? Bitte?
Come back inside, you don't need to stand watch through this!
U is out there, killing herself over this.
And I just want to comfort her.

Fields.MenuText: Me too. I really just want to lighten her load.
Me too, but we have to respect her autonomy.
Yeah. But that's not what she wants.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. I just can't stand feeling so useless.
Sorry, this was inappropriate. I'll get over it.
Especially since... she doesn't seem to want us to.
I can see that... You like fruits?
Are you going to be awkward, or are you going to sit down?
Come on. Out with it, Freddy.
Er. As you know, we're speeding away, in the opposite direction of the enemy's major forces right now.
Ja. And I don't think they can catch up to us.
Unless... the enemy has an advance party ahead of us... We're about to be pincered.
Then let's take out the stragglers, before reinforcements come.
We'll have have to cut through their frontline quickly, before we're surrounded by the main force.
Then let's go. Full speed ahead!
Yeah? What were you thinking of doing?
Another generous dinner for the crew, of course.
You spare no expense. You really love your crew, don't you?
I think... they deserve all the praise in the world. For standing together with me for this long...
Then what are we waiting for?
Before we eat... let's clear the riffraff, eh?

Fields.MenuText: Pace yourself, all right?
Give thanks to U-37, all right?

Fields.DialogueText: Dammit. I just want to hold her in my arms and be her rock...
How is it more selfless or noble to just ignore that and leave her alone?
I don't get it at all. It's not fair...
The Morganas have been herding us in different directions as of late.
They've been leaving stragglers as bait, and picking better formations...
What do you think it means?
It might all be lead up to a single engagement.
I think... we at least have some trouble coming.
That Morgana... it has pieces of Type-IX submarines incorporated into its body.
Scraps of my sisters are in that Morgana.
I'll kill every last one of you!
You won't get away this time!
I still have more... feelings to work through.
Keep coming at me, you witches!
I need to... dematerialize for a while.
I hope it isn't a hurricane.
Kapitän, what are you doing out here?
I should be asking you that!
You know me, Kappi. You know I'll stand watch through any storm.

Fields.MenuText: I'll leave you be.
I'll ask you to come in.
I'll stand watch with you.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't be absurd. You aren't built the same way I am.
Anyway, we'll both be going in now.
Kapitän, we need to be inside in order to man the torpedos.
Yikes. She's back out there again...
It hurts to watch her, suffer alone like that.
It's all right. She lives for it.
She's... the embodiment of the fiery spirit of our crew.
Does she know you think that way?
I've accepted you for who you are, Uzi.
They're still coming! Fire on my command!
You suck at this game, Kappi!
Why don't you ask someone else to play?
I need to check on the ship. I'll be back.
M-My apologies, Kapitän. Just a little prank.
Seaman Rivers... What have you pulled this poor sucker into?
Hah! Aye, you caught me, Captain.
... It was more like you walked up to me and confessed rather than me catching you.
I'm no villain. Just foolin' around, Captain.
All right, all right. Just a little to-do in the mess hall. Nothing that a few mops and some elbow grease and maybe a blowtorch can't fix.
I've been reflecting on my actions.
I've been projecting my bitterness onto you, venting my frustration at you, and...
No matter how much I think I'm doing what I do for U's sake...
I can't help but be selfish too.
I'm going to stand back for a bit.
Take care of our Belle, all right?

Fields.MenuText: I will.
No.
Know your place.

Fields.DialogueText: Good. I leave this in your hands.
Are you still angry about what the boys did?
Your hall has since been cleaned.
Well, I wanted to make sure you knew it was just a joke.
Kapitän! None of that is important!
Then let's get to it, Uzi.
It's really not our place, remember?
I'm in good spirits. Let's go on a mission!
I don't have anything for you apart from the regular patrol.
I want to go to places where I've fought before.
Ships that don't have Belles in them, do you think they have feelings?
And when they sink, they're most likely going to become Nixe food...
What if... the Nixen chasing us have absorbed the hatred of ships that I've sunk.

Fields.MenuText: That makes sense.
That doesn't make sense.
I don't think the Morganas do what they do just because they hate you, Uzi. Relax.

Fields.DialogueText: Right? Who else would have a grudge on me?
Erm. Maybe I'm not quite getting how the process works.
But what if there's even a chance?
Bah. Are you willing to go or not?

Fields.MenuText: When do we leave?
Let's think on it.

Fields.DialogueText: I knew I could count on you, Kapitän!
That means no. Just say so!
You have sunk a lot of ships in your time, Uzi.
... I've received word from Admiral Cutter.
There was another U-boat lost southwest of the Azores. No survivors.

Fields.MenuText: Uzi, I'm so sorry.
You know we're going to have a chance to avenge her soon.
Maybe I should leave you alone.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll just... be by myself in my room for a while.
That's good to hear. I was worried about you.

Fields.MenuText: Yes. That's right.
No, I'm asking as your superior.
Are you holding that against me? That I wanted to be your friend?

Fields.DialogueText: And friends confide in each other, right?
You have superiors trying to keep an eye on us now.
We can't move as freely now.
The Kriegsmarine don't want state-of-the-art U-boat technology to fall into enemy hands.
Uzi, I have something to tell you.
These scavengers aren't going to absorb me too!
Uzi, are you all right? I'd be exhausted, if I were you.

Fields.MenuText: I'm tired of this spoiled act.
I'm trying to be patient, in your time of mourning.

Fields.DialogueText: You're trying to get revenge, right? On the Morganas?
Nein. It's not like that would change anything.
Are you sure it was Morganas that sank your sister ships?
No, I'm sure they did. But...
If it came down to destroying their own ship or letting the Morganas absorb a U-boat...
Just say what you want to say, Kapitän.
The Kriegsmarine are proposing a whole new set of guidelines for the scuttling of U-boats in the face of "unwinnable battles." They're... likely to be extreme.
My fear is that they're going to be calling for the wholesale destruction of ships that can still be saved. I'm already working on a counter-proposal, but--
Kapitän, this is classified information. How do you know it?
I'm sorry, Kapitän. I need a moment.
... So you're ready to open up.
Kapitän, the Unterseeboots were built for a different war against a different enemy. We're not effective the way we're supposed to be. We're an experiment that's failing.
It's why... I wanted to die on the battlefield, as a warrior.
But... I couldn't bear to let anything happen to the crew. Or to you...
So I resigned myself to be the warrior that always outlasted every other in battle.
I'm already considered one of the greatest U-boats of all time.
Do you know how many tons of ships lie at the bottom of the ocean by my hands, Kapitän?
So... I decided to come to terms with being scuttled when my time came. It would be an ending with honor.

Fields.MenuText: I refuse to let that happen!
But is that what you want?
Yeah. That's nonsense.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm so scared, I don't know what to do!
But I'm... the fiery heart of the fleet.
That's what I was told. My courage inspires the crew... And I have a responsibility to them.
I'll face my fate with dignity.
Stop. We haven't received orders to scuttle you. I wouldn't accept those orders if they came.
You're more than entitled to feel sad over the loss of your sisters and cousins. You're entitled to be afraid. You've lost too much and been hit too hard and haven't had much chance to grieve.
No! Give me a straight answer! Is that what you want!?
It's seemed likely to me from the start that the Kriegsmarine would... eventually have to cut their losses with us.
The proposed scuttling protocols are still being taken under advisement, and I'm calling in every contact I have to protest them.
Whatever the official result, though, we're not going to sink our submarines at the first sign of trouble just because some desk jockey in Berlin is having a panic attack.
Both because you and your sisters don't deserve it on a personal level and because you're devastating weapons when used properly.
But don't for a second think that your captain and your crew will just walk away from you when you need us. It's not going to happen. You're going to see this war through to the end.
So I need you to start thinking accordingly. Got it?
We have another Nixe on our hands, and I'm good to go, Kapitän!
If the day comes that you're told the ship will be scuttled...
If they tell you to open all the valves and hatches to fill the hull with seawater...
Play along. Then close the hatches.
How can I trust that will work out?
I'll take care of the details. I promise.
Have you ever known me to neglect my responsibilities? My word?
Wait for me... And I'll be there on the other side.
Kapitän... You've stuck by me this whole time.

Fields.MenuText: This is just what I do for my comrades.
You're my friend.
No reason.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, you're a noble soul, then.
I... I think the same of you, Kappi. I'd die for you.
What word did you have in mind, Kapitän?
More than a word, actually. Two points. No, three.
Two. The proposed protocols for keeping U-boat technology out of Morgana hands have basically been watered down to a stern warning that it shouldn't be allowed to happen.
I don't know how long that will be the status quo - but, for now, the matter is settled.
One. I've asked the base chaplain to draw up some plans for a memorial service for the U-boats and crews we've recently lost. Your attendance won't be mandatory, but if it might help....
Still... point three. Just a hypothetical - but I want you to remember it.
